text: The Doom of the Wicked City is Certain
Woe to the city \add that has shed\add* ⸤much blood⸥!\f + \fr 3:1 \ft Literally “bloods” \f*
⸤She is a deceiver⸥,\f + \fr 3:1 \ft Literally “All of her \fq is \ft deception” \f*
She is filled \add with\add* plunder,
⸤She has hoarded her spoils of war⸥.\f + \fr 3:1 \ft Literally “Prey does not depart” \f*
The crack of the whip!
The rumbling of the \add chariot\add* wheel!
The galloping of the horse!
The racing of the chariot!
Chariots charge!
Swords flash!
Spears glitter!
⸤Many corpses are piled high⸥!\f + \fr 3:3 \ft Literally “Many dead, piles of corpses” \f*
There is no end to the slain!
They stumble over their dead!
Harlot Nineveh Will Get What She Deserves
“Because of the many idolatries of \add the\add* prostitute,
the beautiful charm \add of\add* a mistress of witchcraft,
she who enslaves nations by her harlotries,
and peoples by her sorceries,
“Look! I am against you!” ⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 3:5 \ft Literally “a declaration of” \f*Yahweh.
“I will strip up your skirts over your face;
I will let nations look \add at\add* your nakedness and your shame.
“I will throw filth upon you,
I will treat you with contempt,
I will make you a spectacle.
“And it will be that everyone who sees you will flee from you,
And ⸤they⸥\f + \fr 3:7 \ft Hebrew “he” \f* will say, ‘Nineveh is destroyed!’
Who will mourn for her?
From whence shall I seek comforters for you?”
Nineveh Will Suffer the Same Fate She Inflicted on Thebes
Are you better than Thebes?\f + \fr 3:8 \ft Hebrew “No-Amon” \f*
She who sits at the Nile, surrounded by her waters,
her rampart \add was the\add* sea and water \add was\add* her wall.
Cush \add was\add* her strength, Egypt without end;
Put and Libya were among ⸤your allies⸥.\f + \fr 3:9 \ft Literally “your helpers” \f*
Yet she went into captivity as an exile;
her children were dashed to pieces at the head of \add the\add* streets;
they cast lots for all of her nobles;
all of her dignitaries were bound with chains.
You also will behave like a drunkard;
You also will hide yourself;
You also will seek refuge from \add the\add* enemy.
Nineveh’s Defenses Will Fail
All of your fortifications \add are like\add* fig trees with \add ripe\add* firstfruits—
if they are shaken, they will fall into the mouth of the eater.
Look! Your troops \add are like\add* women in your midst.
The gates of your land are wide open to your enemies;
fire will consume the bars \add of your gates\add*.
Draw water for a siege!
Strengthen your fortifications!
Go to the mud \add pit\add*!
Trample the clay!
Grasp the brick mold!
There fire will consume you;
the sword will cut you off.
It will consume you like the locust.
Nineveh’s Defenders Will Flee
Multiply yourself like the locust!
Multiply yourself like the grasshopper!
You have increased your merchants more than the stars of heaven;
\add like\add* the locust they will shed \add their skin\add* and fly away.
Your officials \add are\add* like locusts;
your commanders \add are\add* like a swarm of locusts.
They encamp on the walls on a cold day;
when the sun rises, they fly away—
no one knows where they have gone.
Nineveh Will Come to an End
Your shepherds are sleeping, \add O\add* king of Assyria!
Your nobles slumber.
Your people are scattered on the mountains;
no one can gather them.
There is no healing for your wound;
your injury is fatal.
All who hear the report of you will clap \add their\add* hands \add for joy\add* concerning you,
⸤For who has not suffered at the hands of your endless cruelty⸥?\f + \fr 3:19 \ft Literally “For over whom has your endless cruelty not passed?” \f*
